author: D. Peter Boucher, Kt. SMOM, International Master Mariner (retd.)
content:
Very interesting Report which I have just made a first reading of and saved for further study in my files. Thank you for Jean-Pierre for the link. It is important I believe that in addition to the centre and at least the windows on either side to Port and Starboard not radiused.

Good Watch

author: Jean-Pierre Declemy
content:
Moving the bridge forward is good, but I hope the designers looked carefully at the MAIB report on the collision between the City of Rotterdam and Primula Seaways where the radiused bridge windows on CoR caused a loss of situational awareness.
Full report here https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/media/58984f60ed915d06e1000025/MAIBInvReport3-2017.pdf

author: D. Peter Boucher, Kt. SMOM, International Master Mariner (retd.)
content:
vive la france et bon voyage Canopee.

Well now this is an example of RoR and fuel savings both being observed. A well designed forward Bridge and accomodation. No doubt Jean-Pierre is as pleased as I am that this has been achieved.

Good Watch
